question: List symptoms of congenital toxoplasmosis triad.
ideal_answer: Classic triad of toxoplasmosis include hydrocephalus, cerebral calcification and chorioretinitis.

snippets.text: Most patients had systemic manifestations, but only 25% of diagnosed patients exhibited the classic triad of hydrocephalus, cerebral calcification and chorioretinitis.

The pathogenic potential of T. gondii was recognized in the 1920s and 1930s, in congenitally infected children presenting with the classic triad of symptoms, namely hydrocephalus, retinochoroiditis and encephalitis.
Intracranial calcifications within the classical triad were only found in two cases.
Congenital toxoplasmosis is characterized by the classical triads: hydrocephaly, chorioretinitis and intracerebral calcifications.
Most patients had systemic manifestations, but only 25% of diagnosed patients exhibited the classic triad of hydrocephalus, cerebral calcification and chorioretinitis.
